verses.verse: Who hath believed <WH539> our report <WH8052>? and to whom is the arm <WH2220> of the LORD <WH3068> revealed <WH1540>?

For he shall grow up <WH5927> before <WH6440> him as a tender plant <WH3126>, and as a root <WH8328> out of a dry <WH6723> ground <WH776>: he hath no form <WH8389> nor comeliness <WH1926>; and when we shall see <WH7200> him, there is no beauty <WH4758> that we should desire <WH2530> him.

He is despised <WH959> and rejected <WH2310> of men <WH376>; a man <WH376> of sorrows <WH4341>, and acquainted <WH3045> with grief <WH2483>: and we hid as it were <WH4564> our faces <WH6440> from him; he was despised <WH959>, and we esteemed <WH2803> him not.

¶ Surely <WH403> he hath borne <WH5375> our griefs <WH2483>, and carried <WH5445> our sorrows <WH4341>: yet we did esteem <WH2803> him stricken <WH5060>, smitten <WH5221> of God <WH430>, and afflicted <WH6031>.

But he was wounded <WH2490> for our transgressions <WH6588>, he was bruised <WH1792> for our iniquities <WH5771>: the chastisement <WH4148> of our peace <WH7965> was upon him; and with his stripes <WH2250> we are healed <WH7495>.

All we like sheep <WH6629> have gone astray <WH8582>; we have turned <WH6437> every one <WH376> to his own way <WH1870>; and the LORD <WH3068> hath laid <WH6293> on him the iniquity <WH5771> of us all.

He was oppressed <WH5065>, and he was afflicted <WH6031>, yet he opened <WH6605> not his mouth <WH6310>: he is brought <WH2986> as a lamb <WH7716> to the slaughter <WH2874>, and as a sheep <WH7353> before <WH6440> her shearers <WH1494> is dumb <WH481>, so he openeth <WH6605> not his mouth <WH6310>.

He was taken <WH3947> from prison <WH6115> and from judgment <WH4941>: and who shall declare <WH7878> his generation <WH1755>? for he was cut off <WH1504> out of the land <WH776> of the living <WH2416>: for the transgression <WH6588> of my people <WH5971> was he stricken <WH5061>.

And he made <WH5414> his grave <WH6913> with the wicked <WH7563>, and with the rich <WH6223> in his death <WH4194>; because he had done <WH6213> no violence <WH2555>, neither was any deceit <WH4820> in his mouth <WH6310>.

¶ Yet it pleased <WH2654> the LORD <WH3068> to bruise <WH1792> him; he hath put him to grief <WH2470>: when thou shalt make <WH7760> his soul <WH5315> an offering for sin <WH817>, he shall see <WH7200> his seed <WH2233>, he shall prolong <WH748> his days <WH3117>, and the pleasure <WH2656> of the LORD <WH3068> shall prosper <WH6743> in his hand <WH3027>.

He shall see <WH7200> of the travail <WH5999> of his soul <WH5315>, and shall be satisfied <WH7646>: by his knowledge <WH1847> shall my righteous <WH6662> servant <WH5650> justify <WH6663> many <WH7227>; for he shall bear <WH5445> their iniquities <WH5771>.

Therefore will I divide <WH2505> him a portion with the great <WH7227>, and he shall divide <WH2505> the spoil <WH7998> with the strong <WH6099>; because he hath poured out <WH6168> his soul <WH5315> unto death <WH4194>: and he was numbered <WH4487> with the transgressors <WH6586>; and he bare <WH5375> the sin <WH2399> of many <WH7227>, and made intercession <WH6293> for the transgressors <WH6586>.
